heading: dot con
subheading: buzzword ever since al gore claimed to have invented the internet, all that’s left to fight over are fragments of net protocol. sun microsystems’ ads proclaim "we’re the dot in .com," a strangely opaque boast even for a tech company. network solutions counters that its employees are "the dot com people," brazenly ignoring sun’s claim […]
author: tom mcnichol
text: buzzwordever since al gore claimed to have invented the internet, all that's left to fight over are fragments of net protocol. sun microsystems' ads proclaim "we're the dot in .com," a strangely opaque boast even for a tech company. network solutions counters that its employees are "the dot com people," brazenly ignoring sun's claim that they put the dot there in the first place. gte, seeing the dot-com territory hopelessly crowded, claims "we put the @ symbol in your email address."so far, bragging rights to the slash and the colon are wide open.must readthree-minute metaldot condigging for dataspace cadetskiss and sellweb of delusiontired/wiredeyes for your earspeoplejargon watchshrink-to-fit genessyndication nationtracking the sweet spotraw data
